width="20%" |Player !width=20%|Date of birth !width=6%|ODIs !width=6%|Batting !width=20%|Bowling style !width=20%|List A team |- | 54 || Sarfraz Ahmed (c) (wk) || || 70 || Right || – || Sindh |- | 56 || Babar Azam (vc)|| || 26 || Right || Right arm off break || Baluchistan |- | 19 || Ahmed Shehzad || || 78 || Right || Right arm leg spin || Baluchistan |- | 79 || Azhar Ali || || 45 || Right || Right arm leg spin || Baluchistan |- | 41 || Faheem Ashraf || || – || Left || Right arm medium || Punjab |- | 39 || Fakhar Zaman || || – || Left || Slow left arm orthodox || Khyber Pakhtunkhwa |- | 32 || Hasan Ali || || 16 || Right || Right arm medium-fast || Islamabad |- | 9 || Imad Wasim || || 21 || Left || Slow left arm orthodox || Islamabad |- | 83 || Junaid Khan || || 58 || Right || Left arm fast || Sindh |- | 5 || Mohammad Amir || || 32 || Left || Left arm fast || Sindh |- | 8 || Mohammad Hafeez || || 185 || Right || Right arm off break || Khyber Pakhtunkhwa |- | 29 || Shadab Khan || || 3 || Right || Right arm leg spin || Islamabad |- | 18 || Shoaib Malik || || 247 || Right || Right arm off break || Punjab |- | 89 || Haris Sohail || || 22 || Left || Slow left arm orthodox || Islamabad |- | 47 || ~~Wahab Riaz~~ || || 78 || Right || Left arm fast || Punjab |- | 15 || Rumman Raees || || – || Right || Left arm fast- medium || Sindh |} Umar Akmal was included in the provisional squad named by the PCB, but failed a fitness test and was called back from England. Haris Sohail was named as his replacement. Wahab Riaz was ruled out of the tournament with an ankle injury after his team's opening match. Kusal Perera was ruled out of the tournament with a hamstring injury and was replaced by Dhananjaya de Silva. ===South Africa=== Coach: Russell Domingo {| border="0" cellspacing="2" cellpadding="2" style="width:100%;" |- style="background:#aad0ff;" !width=5%|No. ! width="20%" |Player !width=20%|Date of birth !width=6%|ODIs !width=6%|Batting !width=20%|Bowling style !width=20%|List A team |- | 17 || AB de Villiers (c) || || 219 || Right || Right-arm medium || Titans |- | 1 || Hashim Amla || || 153 || Right || Right-arm medium || Cape Cobras |- | 28 || Farhaan Behardien || || 56 || Right || Right-arm fast-medium || Titans |- | 12 || Quinton de Kock (wk) || || 82 || Left || – || Lions |- | 18 || Faf du Plessis (vc)|| || 110 || Right || Leg break || Titans |- | 21 || Jean-Paul Duminy || || 174 || Left || Right-arm off break || Cape Cobras |- | 16 || Keshav Maharaj || || 2 || Right || Left arm orthodox || Dolphins |- | 10 || David Miller || || 96 || Left || Right-arm off break || Dolphins |- | 65 || Morné Morkel || || 109 || Left || Right-arm fast || Titans |- | 2 || Chris Morris || || 26 || Right || Right-arm fast-medium || Titans |- | 7 || Wayne Parnell || || 63 || Left || Left-arm medium-fast || Warriors |- | 23 || Andile Phehlukwayo || || 16 || Left || Right-arm fast–medium || Dolphins |- | 29 || Dwaine Pretorius || || 10 || Right || Right-arm fast-medium || Lions |- | 25 || Kagiso Rabada || || 37 || Left || Right-arm fast || Lions |- | 99 || Imran Tahir || || 75 || Right || Leg break || Lions |} ==References== ==External links== * ICC Champions Trophy 2017 Squads on ESPN Cricinfo Category:ICC Champions Trophy squads Category:2017 ICC Champions Trophy
